intro: Hieracium crinisquamum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are hairy and serrated, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium crinisquamum is often found in high-altitude environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
